summary:
The Security Council,

Recalling its previous resolutions and statements on the situation in the Democratic Republic of the Congo, Burundi, and the Great Lakes region,

Paying tribute to the Democratic Republic of the Congo's citizens for their commitment to the democratic process,

Taking note of the Secretary-General's letter (S/2006/892) and its recommendation,

Noting the successful performance of 50 military observers deployed from ONUB, who will be repatriated by 31 December 2006,

Condemning continued hostilities by militias and foreign armed groups in eastern Democratic Republic of the Congo, threatening civilians and regional stability,

Deploring human rights and international humanitarian law violations, particularly by militias, foreign armed groups, and elements of the Armed Forces of the Democratic Republic of the Congo (FARDC),

Bearing in mind the expiring mandates of ONUB (31 December 2006) and MONUC (15 February 2007),

Looking forward to the Secretary-General's proposals on MONUC's future mandate,

Noting the situation in the Democratic Republic of the Congo remains a threat to international peace and security,

Acting under Chapter VII of the Charter,

1. Authorizes a temporary increase in MONUC's military strength by up to 916 personnel from 1 January 2007 until 15 February 2007, to integrate an infantry battalion and military hospital from ONUB,
2. Expresses intention to examine this issue further before 15 February 2007, in light of the Secretary-General's proposals, to ensure MONUC has adequate capabilities,
3. Decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
